array.name: trivia
array.item: Birthday of John Edgar Hoover,the first Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI)
1st photo of the Moon (French photographer Louis Daguerre) in 1839
Birthday of famous Formula 1 Racer Michael Schumacher
NASAs Mars Rover Spirit lands on Martian surface in the year 2004
First publication of The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyl and Mr. Hyde written by R.L. Stevenson in the 1886 by Longmans, Green and Co.
Vietnam holds its first ever General Elections in 1946
Astronomer Galilio Galilei discovers first 3 moons of Jupiter - Io, Europa and Ganymede
Birth Anniversary of famous English physicist and cosmologist, Stephen Hawking
The first known Womens Golf Tournament is held at Musselburgh Golf Club, Scotland in 1811
India and Pakistan sign the Tashkent Peace Accord in 1966
Astronomer William Herschel discovers the moons of Uranus - Titania and Oberon
Birth anniversary of Swami Vivekanand celebrated as National Youth Day in India
The 1st Mickey Mouse comic strip appears in the year 1930
Margrethe II of Denmark becomes the first Queen of Denmark since 1412 in 1972
Elizabeth I crowned Queen of England in Westminster Abbey in 1559
French King Louis XVI sentenced to death by the National Convention during the French Revolution in 1793
Captain James Cook becomes 1st to cross Antarctic Circle in 1773
Bentley Motors Limited is founded in 1919 at Cricklewood, London
The first electric lighting system employing overhead wires, built by Thomas Edison, begins service at Roselle, New Jersey in 1883
President Jimmy Carter announces US boycott of Olympics in Moscow in 1980
British crime writer Agatha Christie publishes her first novel "The Mysterious Affair at Styles" introducing the character Hercule Poirot in 1921
Birthday of American pharmacist Wilbur Scoville, the creator of the Scoville Scale used to measure the pungency or "heat" of chilli peppers
Birth Anniversary of Indian nationalist and freedom fighter Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose
1st canned beer, Kruegers Cream Ale, is sold by American company Krueger Brewing Co.
Moscow University is established by Elizabeth of Russia and founded by Mikhail Lomonosov in 1755
India becomes a Republic in the year 1950
Birthday of English writer Lewis Caroll, author of the famous Alices Adventurers in Wonderland
Sir Thomas Warner founds the first English colony in the Caribbean, on Saint Kitts in 1624
Karl Benz patents the Benz Patent-Motorwagen in Karlsruhe, Germany, the worlds 1st automobile with a burning motor
Around the World in 80 Days by Jules Verne is published in France by Pierre-Jules Hetzel in 1873
Yellowstone becomes the worlds first national park in 1872
University of Illinois opens in 1868
Anne Sullivan begins teaching 6 year old Helen Keller, who later went on to become the first deaf-blind person to earn a Bachelor of Arts degree and a renowned author
Britains first electric trams run in East London in 1882
Samuel Colt manufactures first pistol, 34-caliber "Texas" model in the year 1836
Portuguese navigator Ferdinand Magellan discovers the island of Guam in 1521
Alexander Graham Bell patents the telephone in 1876
International Womens Day
Nicolaus Copernicus records his 1st astronomical observation in 1497
Abraham Lincoln applies for a patent (only US President to do so) for a device to lift a boat over shoals and obstructions
Michelle Bachelet is inaugurated as the first female president of Chile in 2006
University of Vienna founded in 1365
American Chester Greenwood patents earmuffs after inventing them at age 15 in 1877
Celebrated as Pi day : 3 14 correspond to the first 3 significant digits of the Pi constant
Julius Caesar is stabbed to death by Brutus, Cassius and several other Roman senators on the Ides of March in Rome in 44 BC
Adolf Hitler names Hjalmar Schacht as President of Bank of Germany in 1933
Bristol man Henry Jones patents self-raising flour 1845
Benito Mussolini and Italy join Hitler in Germanys war against France and Britain in 1940
Although unknown at the time, Pluto is 1st photographed in the year 1915
Harriet Beecher Stowes "Uncle Toms Cabin" published in Boston in 1852
Persia is officially renamed Iran in 1935
1st patent for lasers granted to Arthur Schawlow and Charles Townes in 1960
1st telephone installed at the Presidents desk under the Hoover administration at the White House in 1929
Birthday of Tommy Hilfiger, principal designer at the fashion giant Tommy Hilfiger Corporation
Birthday of famous English singer and song-writer Elton John
Queen Elizabeth II sent out the first royal email, from the Royal Signals and Radar Establishment in 1976
Abraham Gesner patents kerosene in 1855
Rocket Pioneer Robert Goddard uses gyroscopes to control a rocket in 1935
Ludwig van Beethoven, aged 24 makes his debut performance as a pianist in Vienna in 1795
1st recorded perihelion passage of Halleys Comet in 240 BC
Apple Inc. co-founded in 1976 by Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak and Ronald Wayne
Gerbert of Aurillac elected as 1st French Pope in 999
Bobby Fischer stripped of world chess title for refusing to defend it in 1975
US civil rights activist Martin Luther King Jr. assassinated in Memphis, Tennessee in 1968
Isaac Quintard patents apple cider vinegar in 1806
Birthday of James Dewey Watson, co-author of the academic paper on the double-helix structure of DNA
IBM announces the System/360 family of mainframe computers in 1964
Milk sold in glass bottles for 1st time in 1879
Samuel R Percy patents dried milk in 1872
US patent system forms in 1790
The first modern submarine designed and built by John Philip Holland is purchased by the U.S. Navy in 1900
Polio vaccine tested by Dr Jonas Salk announced to be safe and effective in year 1955
First elephant arrives in US from India in 1796
Birth Anniversary of the Father of the Indian Constitution, Dr. B.R. Ambedkar
Bank of England issues first 5 pound note in 1793
Queen Anne of England knights Isaac Newton at Trinity College, Cambridge in 1705
India entered space age launching SLV-3 rocket in 1983
Zimbabwe (formerly Southern Rhodesia) declares independence from UK in 1980
India launches 1st satellite Aryabhata with help of the USSR
First pasteurization test completed by Frenchmen Louis Pasteur and Claude Bernard in 1862
Central Asian conqueror Babur defeats Sultan Ibrahim Lodi, establishing the Mughal Empire in India in 1526
Birthday of Russian revolutionary Vladimir Lenin
Canada issues its 1st postage stamps in 1851
Eastman Kodak founded by George Eastman in 1888
Daniel Defoe publishes "Robinson Crusoe" in 1719
Copernicus makes his 1st observations of Saturn in 1514
The Australian Labor Party under Prime Minister Chris Watson becomes the first Labor government in the world in 1904
Muhammad Ali refuses induction into army and stripped of boxing title in 1967
Longest sausage ever, at 28.77 miles, made in Kitchener, Ontario in 1995
George Washington is inaugurated as the first President of the United States of America in 1789
Penny Black, the first adhesive postage stamp in the world issued by Great Britain in 1840
William Herschel discovers 1st binary star, Xi Ursae Majoris in 1780
1st broadcast of CBS Evening News - longest running network news show in the US, in 1948
Phonograph, invented by Thomas Alva Edison shown for 1st time at Grand Opera House in 1878
Afrikaans is established as an official language in South Africa in 1925
James Gordon Bennett, Sr. publishes the first issue of the New York Herald (price 1 cent).
US space shuttle STS-49 launched (maiden voyage of Endeavour) in 1992
Ernest Rutherford publishes his discovery of two different kinds of radiation (Alpha and Beta Particles) in 1899
British inventor Joseph Bramah patents beer-pump handle in 1785
Benjamin Franklin tests the lightning conductor with his kite-flying experiment in 1752
Celebrated as National Technology Day in India to mark Indias nuclear test in Pokhran(1998)
Toilet that flushes itself at regular intervals is patented in 1792
3 astronauts simultaneous walked in space for the 1st time onboard space shuttle Endeavour in 1992
Louis XIV becomes King of France aged just 4 in 1643
ATandT becomes the 1st US corporation to have a million stockholders in 1951
Queen Elizabeth II becomes 1st British monarch to address US congress in 1991
Russian probe Venera 6 landed on Venus in 1969
Peoples Republic of China launches 1st intercontinental rocket in 1980
Birthday of former Prime Minister of Vietnam, Ho Chi Minh
Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama arrives at Calicut, India becoming the first European to reach India by sea in 1498
FIFA established in Paris, France in 1904
Dr Washington Sheffield invents the toothpaste tube in 1892
Walt Disney incorporates his 1st film company Laugh-O-Gram Films in 1922
Samuel Morse taps out "What hath God wrought" in the worlds first telegraph message in 1844
Goofy, aka Dippy Dawg, 1st appears in Mickeys Revue by Walt Disney in 1932
Napoleon Bonaparte is crowned King of Italy in 1805
Golden Gate Bridge in San Francisco opens to pedestrians in 1937
Alan Turing submits "On Computable Numbers" for publication, in which he set out the theoretical basis for modern computers in 1936
Edmund Hillary (NZ) and Tenzing Norgay (Nepal) are first to reach the summit of Mount Everest as part of a British Expedition in 1953
Spanish explorer Hernando de Soto discovers Florida in 1539
Thomas Edison granted his first patent for the Electric Vote Recorder in 1869
Coronation of Queen Elizabeth II in Westminster Abbey, London, England in 1953
Worlds largest environmental summit opens in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil in 1992
Henry Ford takes his 1st Ford through streets of Detroit in 1896
World Environment Day
Young Mens Christian Association (YMCA) formed by George Williams in London in 1844
Richard Lee (Virginia) moves Declaration of Independence in Continental Congress in 1776
French Open Womens Tennis: Serena Williams wins her first French title beating older sister Venus Williams in 2002
1st appearance of Donald Duck in a cartoon, "The Wise Little Hen" in 1934
US Equal Pay Act signed into law by President John F. Kennedy in 1963
Captain James Cook discovers Great Barrier Reef off Australia in 1770
Anne Frank gets her diary as a birthday present in Amsterdam in 1942, aged 13
President Kim Dae Jung of South Korea meets Kim Jong-il, leader of North Korea, for the beginning of the first ever inter-Korea summit, in the northern capital of Pyongyang
Charles Babbage proposes his Difference Engine in a paper to the Royal Astronomical Society in 1822
Charles Goodyear patents the vulcanization of rubber in 1844
Ford Motors under Henry Ford incorporates in 1903
Mumtaz Mahal dies during childbirth. Her husband, Mughal emperor Shah Jahan I, then spends more than 20 years building her tomb, the Taj Mahal
William Penn founds Philadelphia, US in 1682
1st photoelectric cell installed commercially West Haven, Connecticut in 1931
Tennis Court Oath (for a new constitution) in France made at Versailles in 1789
Summer Solstice in Northern Hemisphere
John Howe patents pin manufacturing machine in 1832
Birthday of British mathematician, computer scientist and professor at Cambridge, Alan Turing, often regarded as the Father of Artificial Intelligence
1st exhibition by Pablo Picasso, 19, opens in Paris in 1901
Venetian Elena Cornaro Piscopia is awarded a doctorate of philosophy, the 1st woman to receive a university doctoral degree or PhD, in 1678
Karl Benz of Germany receives US patent for gasoline-driven auto in 1894
Chlorophyll "A" synthesized in Cambridge, Massachusetts in 1960
Final draft of Declaration of Independence submitted to Continental Congress in 1776
"A.I. Artificial Intelligence", directed by Steven Spielberg and starring Haley Joel Osment, Jude Law and Frances O Connor, is released in 2001
Mahatma Gandhis 1st arrest after campaigning for Indian rights in South Africa in 1914
Celebrated as Doctors Day in India to mark the birth anniversary of eminent Indian physician Dr.Bidhan Chandra Roy
1st US elevated railroad begins service in New York City in 1867
In Germany, Karl Benz drives 1st automobile in 1886
American Independence Day
Isaac Newtons great work PRINCIPIA published by Royal Society in England in 1687, which outlines his laws of motion and universal gravitation.
Horlicks of Wisconsin offers 1st malted milk to public in 1886
Isaac Newton receives MA from Trinity College, Cambridge in 1668
Alfred Carlton Gilberts patent for the Erector Set is issued in 1913, it becomes one of the most popular toys of all time
Argentina declares independence from Spain in 1816
Yankee Clipper completes 1st passenger flight over Atlantic in 1938
Italian scientist Amedeo Avogadro publishes his memoir on the molecular content of gases in 1811
1st manned flight by gas balloon in Netherlands in 1785
The Hollywood Sign is officially dedicated in the hills above Hollywood, Los Angeles in 1923
Bastille Day - the French Revolution begins with the fall of the Bastille Prison. Celebrated as Independence Day in France
City of Jerusalem is captured and plundered by Christian forces during the First Crusade in 1099
1st banknotes in Europe are issued by Bank of Stockholm in 1661
1st US dental school, Harvard School of Dental Medicine, established in 1867
Birthday of South African anti-apartheid revolutionary and political leader Nelson Mandela
1st Wimbledon Mens Tennis: 27 year old English rackets player Spencer Gore wins inaugural event; beats William Marshall 6-1, 6-2, 6-4 in 1877
Fee 1st charged to see a baseball game (50 cents) (NY beats Bkln 22-18) in 1858
1st Test Cricket match played at Lords in 1884
The Beatles release "Introducing the Beatles" in 1963
William Austin Burt patents Americas first typographer (typewriter) in 1829
Edmund Halley enters The Queens College, Oxford, as an undergraduate in 1673
Walter Hunt is awarded the first U.S. patent for a paper shirt collar in 1854
Celebrated as Kargil Victory Day in in India to mark the victory of India over Pakistan in the Kargil War of 1999
Atlantic telegraph cable successfully laid (1,686 miles long) in 1866
French Revolution figure Robespierre and 22 other leaders of "the Terror" guillotined to thunderous cheers in Paris in 1794
1st helicopter ascent in Douai, France in 1907
Birthday of Henry Ford, founder of the the American automobile giant Ford Motors
Joseph Priestley, English theologian, chemist and author discovers oxygen by isolating it in its gaseous state in 1774
Lewis Carroll publishes "Alices Adventures in Wonderland" in 1865
Christopher Columbus sets sail on his first voyage with three ships, Santa Maria, Pinta and Nina from Palos de la Frontera, Spain for the Indies
US government collects its 1st income tax in 1862
Japans first taxicab service begins in Ginza, Tokyo in 1912
Atomic bomb dropped on Hiroshima by the US B-29 Superfortress Enola Gay in 1945
Tokyo Telecommunications Engineering, the precursor to Sony, begins selling its first transistor radios in Japan in 1955
The millionth patent is filed in the United States Patent Office by Francis Holton for a tubeless vehicle tire in 1911
Otis Tuft patents the first passenger elevator in the US in 1859
Louvre palace officially opens in Paris as The Museum Central des Arts in 1793
Airbnb is founded by Brian Chesky, Joe Gebbia and Nathan Blecharczyk in 2008
Henry Fords company builds the first Model T car in 1908
Dutch astronomer Christiaan Huygens discovers Martian south polar cap in 1642
France introduces motor vehicle registration, includes a driving test in 1893
India is declared independent from England in the year 1947
NYC begins building the Grand Central Station in 1904
Korea is divided into North and South Korea in 1945
French Astronomer Pierre Janssen discovers helium in solar spectrum during eclipse in 1868
Details of Louis Daguerres 1st practical photographic process are released in Paris in 1839
NASA launches Voyager 2 towards Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune in 1977
American inventor William Seward Burroughs patents the adding machine in 1888
Mahatma Gandhi forms the Natal Indian Congress (NIC) in order to fight discrimination against Indian traders in Natal in 1894
1st one-way streets open in London in 1617
Charlotte Bronte finishes manuscript of Jane Eyre in 1847
Momofuku Ando markets the first package of precooked instant noodles (Chikin Ramen) in 1958
Birthday of Albanian-Indian Roman Catholic nun and missionary, Mother Teresa
USSR launches Sputnik 3 with two dogs aboard in 1958
Martin Luther King Jr. delivers his I have a dream speech addressing civil rights march at Lincoln Memorial, Washington, D.C.
The Goodyear tire company is founded in 1898
Ram Das becomes the 4th Sikh Guru in 1574
V-J Day, formal surrender of Japan aboard USS Missouri marks the end of WW II in 1945
"A Trip To The Moon", the first sci-fi film, released in 1902
eBay (Electronic Bay) founded by Pierre Omidyar in 1995
English astronomer Edmond Halley observes the comet named after him in 1682
Birth Anniversary of former President of India Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan, celebrated as Teachers Day in India
Adolphe Pegoud becomes 1st aircraft to loop the loop in France in 1913
Edith Eleanor McLean is 1st baby to be placed in an incubator at State Emigrant Hospital on Wards Island, New York in 1888
A masterpiece of Renaissance sculpture, The Statue of David completed by Michelangelo is unveiled in Florence, Italy in 1504
Orville Wright makes 1st 1-hr airplane flight, Fort Myer in 1908
Rock band Nirvana release their famous single "Smells like Teen Spirit" in 1991
9/11 Attack on New York World Trade Towers in 2001
Jean-Paul Marat publishes the first issue of his radical newspaper Le Publiciste parisien, later called Ami du peuple (The Friend of the People) in Paris in 1789
IBM introduces the RAMAC 305, 1st commercial computer with a hard drive that uses magnetic disk storage in 1956
Indian Constituent Assembly adopts Hindi as an official language. Celebrated as Hindi Day in India
Birthday of world-famous mystery novel author Agatha Christie
The "Wall Street bombing" occurs at noon when a horse-drawn wagon explodes on Wall Street, New York, killing 38 and injuring 143 in 1920
William Herschel discovers Mimas, satellite of Saturn in 1789
Royal Opera House in London opens in 1809
Adventures of Superman TV series starring George Reeves premieres in syndication in the US in 1952
Spanish expedition led by Portuguese navigator Ferdinand Magellan sets off on the 1st successful circumnavigation of the globe in 1519
First cowboy film "Kit Carson" premieres in US in 1903
TV drama Charlies Angels starring Farrah Fawcett, Kate Jackson and Jaclyn Smith debuts in 1976
Abdulaziz Ibn Saud merges the Kingdom of Nejd and Hejaz into the Kingdom of Saudi Arab in 1932
President George Washington nominates John Jay for 1st Chief Justice and the US Attorney Genral Office is created in 1789
China launches the spacecraft Shenzhou 7 in 2008
Thomas Jefferson appointed 1st US Secretary of State and John Jay becomes 1st US Chief Justice in 1789
The physics journal Annalen der Physik publishes Albert Einsteins paper introducing his famous energy-mass equivalence equation in 1905
Napoleon Bonaparte (16) graduates from the military academy in Paris in 1785
American oil tycoon John D. Rockefeller becomes the worlds first billionaire in 1916
The Flintstones the first animated sitcom created by Hanna-Barbera premieres on ABC in the US
International Day for the Elderly People
Birth Anniversary of Indian freedom fighter and activist Mahatma Gandhi
1st facsimile photo sent over city telephone lines, Washington, D.C. in 1922
Abraham Lincoln made his 1st political speech at Illinois State Fair in 1854
Harry Truman makes the 1st Presidential address televised from the White House in 1947
Thomas Edison shows his 1st motion picture in 1889
Far side of Moon seen for the 1st time, courtesy of USSRs Luna 3 space probe, in 1959
1927 - "The Second Hundred Years" silent short film released starring Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy - 1st Laurel and Hardy film with them appearing as a team
Birthday of English singer, songwriter and Beatles co-founder John Lennon
Nobel prize for physiology awarded to Alfred G. Gilman and Martin Rodbell for G-protein discoveries
"Professor Quiz" first radio quiz show premieres in 1936
Theodore Roosevelt renames Executive Mansion as The White House in 1901
The Whirlpool Galaxy discovered by Charles Messier in 1773
George Eastman patents paper-strip photographic film in 1884
Ernest Hemingway novel To Have and Have Not published in 1937
Battle of Leipzig, largest battle in Europe prior to WWI, Napoleons forces defeated by Prussia, Austria and Russia in 1813
Bank of Italy (later Bank of America) opens its doors in San Francisco, founded by Amadeo Giannini in 1904
Alaska Purchase: US takes formal possession of Alaska from Russia, having paid 7.2 million dollars in 1867
"1933 - Berlin Olympic Committee vote to introduce basketball in the 1936 games"
US President Abraham Lincoln formally establishes Thanksgiving as a national holiday in 1864
Birthday of Swedish chemist and businessman Alfred Nobel
Google Play is launched, the official app store for the Android operating system
Emperor Akihito becomes the first Emperor of Japan to visit China in 1992
Composer and Pianist Felix Mendelssohn aged 9 performs his first public concert in Berlin in 1818
Birthday of Spanish painter, sculptor and artist Pablo Picasso
Mother Teresa founds Missionaries of Charity in Calcutta, India in 1950
Walt Disneys 1st TV show, "Disneyland", premieres on ABC in 1954
St Louis police try a new investigation method in 1904 - fingerprints!
Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz makes the first use of the long s, ∫, for integral, helping discover integral and differential calculus in 1675
Benito Mussolini forms government in Italy in 1922
John Adams becomes the first US President to live in the White House in 1800
British newspaper "Daily Mirror" begins publishing in 1904
International Radiotelegraph Conference in Berlin selects "SOS" (· · · – – – · · ·) distress signal as the worldwide standard for help in 1906
Howard Carter discovers tomb of Tutankhamun in Egypt in 1922
Akbar (14) succeeds his father Humayun as Sultan of Delhi
Japanese fleet readies assault on Pearl Harbor in 1941
Birthday of Indian physicist C. V. Raman who discovered why the water appears blue and the Raman Effect
German physicist Wilhelm Rontgen produces and detects electromagnetic radiation in a wavelength range today known as X-rays in 1885
Garry Kasparov becomes the youngest ever world chess champion (22), with a 13-11 win over fellow Russian Anatoly Karpov in 1985
John Hughes film "Home Alone" directed by Chris Columbus and starring Macaulay Culkin premieres in Chicago in 1990
German mathematician Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz demonstrates integral calculus for the first time to find the area under the graph of y = f(x) function in 1675
Buzz Aldrin takes the first space selfie, a photo of himself performing extravehicular activity in space during the Gemini program in 1966
Birthday of the famous Scottish novelist Robert Louis Stevenson, autohr of The Treasure Island
American Gail Borden is issued a patent for technology related to his invention of condensed milk in 1856
Isaac Pitman introduces his shorthand system in 1837
Operation Magic Carpet begins with 1st plane from Yemen carrying Jews to Israel in 1948
Elizabeth I aged 25 ascends English throne upon death of her half sister Queen "Bloody" Mary in 1558
Walt Disneys "Steamboat Willie" released, first Mickey Mouse sound cartoon, in 1928
New York receives first Marconi wireless transmission from Italy in 1911
Ludwig van Beethovens "Fidelio", his only opera, premieres in Vienna in 1805
Law banning smoking on most domestic flights signed by US President George H. W. Bush in 1989
American President John F. Kennedy assassinated by Lee Harvey Oswald in Dallas, Texas in 1963
Pencil sharpener patented by J L Love in 1897
English naturalist Charles Darwin publishes "On the Origin of Species" radically changing the view of evolution and laying the foundation for evolutionary biology in 1859
Swedish chemist Alfred Nobel patents dynamite in 1867
"Casablanca" directed by Michael Curtiz and starring Humphrey Bogart and Ingrid Bergman premieres at Hollywood Theater, New York City in 1942
Swedish chemist Alfred Nobels will establishes the Nobel Prize in 1895
Bradman scores 226, the 1st Test Cricket century at Gabba, v South Africa in 1931
Physicist Erwin Schrodinger publishes his famous thought experiment Schrodingers cat, a paradox that illustrates the problem of the Copenhagen interpretation of quantum mechanics in 1935
"Gandhi" directed by Richard Attenborough and starring Ben Kingsley and John Gielgud premieres in New Delhi
Sherlock Holmes first appears in print in "Study in Scarlet" by Arthur Conan Doyle in 1887
Napoleon Bonaparte is crowned Emperor of France in Paris in 1804
Edmond Halley receives MA from The Queens College, Oxford in 1678
The first Burger King is opened in Miami, Florida, USA in 1954
The French currency Franc is created in 1360
London becomes the worlds first city to host licenced taxicabs in 1897
Inventor Leo Baekeland patents the first thermo-setting plastic, Bakelite, sparking the birth of the plastics industry in 1909
With the second launch of the SpaceX Dragon, SpaceX becomes the first privately held company to successfully launch, orbit and recover a spacecraft in 2010
Noah Webster establishes New Yorks 1st daily newspaper, the "American Minerva" in 1793
"Adventures of Huckleberry Finn" by Mark Twain is first published in the UK and Canada in 1884
British Physicist Cecil Frank Powell awarded Nobel Prize in Physics for his study of nuclear processes and the discovery of the pion in 1950
Guglielmo Marconi sends the first transatlantic radio signal, from Poldhu in Cornwall to Newfoundland, Canada in 1901
Dutch explorer Abel Tasman sights the South Island of present day New Zealand in 1642; initially he calls it Staten Landt and changes it a year later to Nieuw Zeeland
Princess Mary Stuart succeeds her father James V and becomes Queen Mary I of Scotland being only 6 days old in 1542
Napoleon Bonaparte receives a French state funeral in Paris in 1840, 19 years after his death
Charlie Chaplin begins his film career at Keystone for 150 dollars a week in 1913
1st impeachment trial against a US senator (William Blount, Tennessee) begins in 1798
Project SCORE, worlds 1st communications satellite launched from Cape Canaveral in 1958
William Pitt the Younger becomes the youngest ever British Prime Minister at age 24 in 1783
"Grimms Fairy Tales" by Jacob Grimm and Wilhelm Grimm is first published in 1812
1st game of basketball, based on rules created by James Naismith, played by 18 students in Springfield, Massachusetts in 1891
1st string of Christmas tree lights is created by Thomas Edison in 1882
English astronomer John Flamsteed observes Uranus without realizing it is undiscovered in 1690
Soviet spacecraft Luna 13 lands on Moon in 1966
1st definite date Christmas was celebrated on Dec 25th was in the year 352
Horror film "The Exorcist" based on book and screenplay by William Peter Blatty, starring Linda Blair, rated X, premieres in 1973- 1st horror film to be nominated for Best Picture
The Hagia Sophia is inaugurated by the Emperor Justinian in 537
First observation of Neptune - Galileo observes and records a "fixed star" without realising it is a planet in 1612
1st American Young Mens Christian Association (YMCA) chapter opened in Boston, Massachusetts in 1851
Creation of the USSR formally proclaimed in Moscow from the Bolshoi Theatre, Soviet Union in 1922
US Supreme Court convenes for 1st time in New York City in 1790
1st leopard exhibited in US, Boston (admission 25 cents) in 1802
Circus owner P. T. Barnum buys his world famous elephant Jumbo in 1882
Birthday of American civil rights activist Rosa Parks, best known for her pivotal role in the Montgomery bus boycott
"Modern Times", silent film directed by, written by and starring Charlie Chaplin, is released in 1936
1st radio-controlled airplane flown in 1948
1st wireless message sent from a moving train to a station received in 1915
Radio arrives at the White House in 1922
Australian National University scientists discover the oldest known star at 13.6 billion years old in 2014
"Tom and Jerry" cartoon created by William Hanna and Joseph Barbera debut by MGM in 1940
"Archie" comic book debuts in 1942
Birthday of the 16th President of the USA, Abraham Lincoln
Tycho Brahe first sketches "Tychonic system" of solar system in 1578
In New York City, James Knox Polk becomes first serving US President to have his photograph taken (by Matthew Brady) in 1849
1st Teddy Bear introduced in America, made by Morris and Rose Michtom in 1903
Howard Carter opens the inner burial chamber of the Pharaoh Tutankhamuns tomb and finds the sarcophagus in 1923
The first superhero, The Phantom, a cartoon strip by Lee Falk, makes his first appearance in comics in 1936
H Cecil Booth patented a dust removing suction cleaner in 1901
Thomas Edison is granted a patent for his gramophone (phonograph) in 1878
Massachusetts Institute of Technology forms 1st US collegiate architectural school in 1865
Lahore Declaration signed between India and Pakistan weapons in 1999
Dolly the Sheep, the first cloned mammal (from an adult cell) is announced by the Roslin Institute in Scotland in 1997
Engineer James Watts patent for a rotary motion for the steam engine (his sun-and-planet gear) is granted
Birthday of American business magnate and co-founder of Apple Inc. Steve Jobs
1st US cabinet meeting, held at George Washingtons home in 1793
Abraham Lincoln signs National Currency Act, establishes single national US currency in 1863
Birthday of American poet and educator H. W. Longfellow
1st US college cooperative store opens, at Harvard University in 1882
Hattie McDaniel becomes 1st African American woman to win an Oscar for "Gone with the Wind" in 1940
Apollo 14 launched in 1971, 1st landing in lunar highlands
Eiffel Tower officially opens in Paris in 1889
Madison Square Garden opens in New York, named after 4th President James Madison in 1879
Christopher Columbus discovers the island of Trinidad on his third voyage in 1498
Thomas Edison patents the Kinetoscope [kinetographic camera], a device which produces moving pictures in 1897
Mount Rushmore Monument is completed in 1941
Queen Victoria chooses Ottawa as new capital of Canada in 1857
